p: Coronaviruses, so named due to the outer fringe of envelope proteins resembling crown (' coronaâ€™ in Latin), are a family of enveloped RNA viruses ( Burrell et al., 2017). They are generally pathogenic to mammals and birds and cause mild upper respiratory tract infections in humans. They occasionally can be transmitted to a larger human population and can cause severe respiratory illnesses exemplified by Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) and Middle-East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) in 2003 and 2012 respectively.
